item.title: More Plant Food
item.description: Gave the plants some more plant food today. The orange blossom has appeared a bit wilty lately. The habenero in the cloth pot seems to have a number of bugs on it. I didn't really see the same on any of the other peppers. I sprayed the habenero's with windex.
item.dc:creator: Michael

item.title: Plants outside
item.description:
"Final" transplanting. In the garden: 2 habaneros, 2 jalepenos, 2 bells. 1 sun sugar, 1 goliath. And the strawberries.

Everything else in pots. Peppers are in second to largest of my plastic pots. Also have a habanero and jalepeno together in the cloth pot.
item.dc:creator: Michael

item.title: Update
item.description:
An update:

Went almost a week without watering.

Sun sugar branches started curling down. Gave them some more water and are looking good now.

Firework had a little bud cluster with about a dozen buds. I clipped it off. Firework looks great.

Sun gold with buds is starting to produce tomatoes. Both sun golds are looking pretty good with new growth. Bottom branches don't look great, kind of yellow. Will probably prune them at next transplant.

Habeneros are looking good with good looking new growth at the top.

I think current water strategy will be every other day or every third day. Especially dependent on how much time the spend outside. More outside more water.
item.dc:creator: Michael

item.title: Topping peppers
item.description: I chopped off the tops of of one of each of the different pepper plants. On these topped plants, I also removed some of the lower leaves. It's possible the plants were too small to top, but I didn't want to wait too long to do it either.
item.dc:creator: Michael

item.title: Too much water
item.description: I am pretty sure I am giving the plants too much water. Especially the peppers. Peppers I will now water every other day max.
item.dc:creator: Michael

item.title: Oregano water
item.description: Did some reading and I think that the oregano has gotten too much water. Probably the other plants also have had too much water but almost definitely the oregano. When I transplant, I think I'll move it to a clay pot.
item.dc:creator: Michael

item.title: More Plucking
item.description:
Did some more plucking today.

Got rid of buds on the two habeneros that are far from the tag.

Got rid of buds on the three jalepenos that are not next to the tag.

Plucked some buds on the sun sugar.

Plucked suckers that were starting to grow on almost all the tomatoes.
item.dc:creator: Michael

item.title: Droopy tomato
item.description: The orange blossom is looking awfully droopy. I think I need to transplant it soon.
item.dc:creator: Michael

item.title: Roots bottoming out
item.description: On pretty much all of the tomatoes, I can see the roots at the drainage holes of the pots. I wanted to wait longer before the final transfer, but I might have to do it soon.
item.dc:creator: Michael

item.title: Orange Blossom
item.description: The orange blossom plant doesn't seem to be doing as well as the others. It just seems to be droopier. I've noticed this for at least a week now. I'm going to not water it today 5/26 and see what happens.
item.dc:creator: Michael

item.title: Family Photo
item.description: Here's the family photo under the grow light:
item.dc:creator: Michael

item.title: Pruning strategy
item.description: Some suggest to prune early buds off of the plants so that the energy goes into producing roots rather than early fruit. I am plucking buds on some plants. For the two sun sugars, I am plucking the buds on the plant whose tag is turned inwards towards the plant. For the jalepenos, I am plucking the buds on all the plants besides the one that is closest to the tag. I haven't plucked any of the other plants yet.
item.dc:creator: Michael

item.title: Plant strawberries
item.description: First plants to go into the garden are the strawberries. I am assuming they will be tough enough to handle the early season planting.
item.dc:creator: Michael

item.title: Strawberries
item.description: Shane has the strawberries we can use. They are hanging in his porch. He says they have been outside all winter
item.dc:creator: Michael

item.title: More Plants!
item.description:
Purchased some more plants! Since I have a garden to use, I figured I could buy a couple more plants.

  • Goliath tomato
  • Firework tomato
  • 4 pack of Italian yellow pepper.

One of the yellow peppers is a doubler.

Transplanted the new plants to larger containers.
item.dc:creator: Michael

item.title: Weeding
item.description: Weeded and tilled garden. There were a lot of weeds but I pulled them all out. Dug down about a foot and loosened up dirt.
item.dc:creator: Michael

item.title: Garden
item.description: I have a garden! I can use the other plot. Just need to plant some strawberries for Shane.
item.dc:creator: Michael

item.title: Outside
item.description: Starting to put plants outside on nice days
item.dc:creator: Michael
